info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF RIPLEY AND SOUTHWESTERN DEARBORN COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 155 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Vernon, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Dillsboro, Moores Hill, Sunman, Holton, Napoleon, Rexville, Cold Springs, Benham, Ballstown, New Marion, Friendship, Versailles Lake, Otter Village and Olean. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 150 and 153. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
